title: It’s unhealthy when Mid is dominated by one class of champions
body:
Clearly, riot is looking to Nerf AP champions again so that other classes like assassins and even possibily ADCs/Bruisers get played more, especially in pro play.

Question Riot, what about Bot lane?

You clearly enforce this rule on every lane but the ADC class. Somehow, they can complete dominance in this lane; any class that challenges this authority, gets nerfed

It gets even weirder when you consider all the changes to other lanes/roles like Support, Jungle and Top. You don’t allow one type of class Ie mages to dominate the lane. 

So why the hypocrisy on ADCs? 
You can’t say you don’t have time, it’s been over 6-7 years now

Please don't confuse a larger category with the subclass of that category.
An ADC is an Attack Damage Carry. This includes things like assassins and divers, along with marksmen. Yasuo, Riven, Kayn, Fiora, Xin Zhao, Zed, and Talon, among many others, are ADCs. Varus, Jhin, Jinx, and other marksmen, are also ADCs.
The bot lane currently consists of a Marksman ADC and a support.

Just saw this statement 2 comments below so I figured I'd respond. Of course a champion can kill another champion. ADC's OP'ness comes from both his damage and supports ability to save him. In addition to that, if a Varus without any escaped walks up to me without paying any attention to me, I'm pretty sure I would kill him with a LOT of champions. Mechanical ineptitude doesn't suddenly mean that your role isn't OP.

If the "op'ness", as you put it, is from the supports ability to save them, then that means that adc's are not the problem, but rather enchanter/tanky peel supports. However, I have to disagree with this. If your ENTIRE team goes out of their way to protect one person, should they not be rewarded for that ? Are you implying that if everyone peels for the adc that the adc should still die ? I've been struggling with this argument for a while now, so maybe you can help explain it.

If a Janna decides that she won't shield anyone but her adc and only pop her ult and redemption for when her carry needs it, then why shouldn't the adc live? In what way is it fair to play support and shield the most consistent form of damage on your team and still have them die despite using everything you have? Despite having your entire team beat down on whoever is diving on them? I think that is fair. I think it is fair that if the entire team can coordinate to protect the one person who needs it, then they should be rewarded by having that adc live and continue to deal the damage they need to win the teamfight. 

That being said, I do not think the damage an adc deals is fair, mostly in crit champions. With infinity edge, rapidfire, and statikk shiv, an adc can deal almost an entire enemie's healthbar. The problem in this case is not the fact that adc's are unkillable. It's the fact that they are supposed to do sustained and consistent damage. When everyone is on cooldowns the adc can still auto. That should come at the price of doing significantly less damage than a fully maxed late game ultimate on a mage. For comparison, A Lux lategame can't one-shot anyone with her ult (except in rare cases involving a fully stacked mejais and rabadons). She can approximately do maybe half health on a squishy, maybe a little more depending on the amount of mr/ap pen. An adc can do more than that damage with on auto. The sad part is that most of the adc's *are* building rapidfire, meaning that auto can come at you from quite a far distance (especially in the case of jinx, caitlyn, and tristana). 

So to help you out, no the role is not op simply for the fact that they don't die. The role is op because they are not giving enough trade off for the damage they do.

Don't try to straw-man me. What I said is "ADC's OP'ness comes from both his damage and supports ability to save him.". Reality is that a single support can peel an adc from the entire 5-man team. You do not need an entire team to peel an adc. It only takes 1 Janna with Redemption, Zeke and Locket to absolutely shut down any attempts to initiate a fight on an adc.

**If a Janna decides that she won't shield anyone but her adc and only pop her ult and redemption for when her carry needs it, then why shouldn't the adc live?**

Because 1 support shouldn't be enough to save an adc from the damage of 3 - 4 people.

**The problem in this case is not the fact that adc's are unkillable. It's the fact that they are supposed to do sustained and consistent damage.**

In fact, both of those are problems. If a character that deals one of the highest burst AND consistent damage simultaneously doesn't die he is objectively op. And since adc and support can be considered a set, which means that whatever happens to either of them directly influences the other part of the set, at this point in the meta adc's are objectively op.

**...no the role is not op simply for the fact that they don't die. The role is op because they are not giving enough trade off for the damage they do.**

They are op BECAUSE they don't die. I`m fine with adc dealing shitton of damage if I can Zed ult him or cc him. But the problem is that none of that works because they don't die. In addition to QSS (which is objectively best on adc's) and GA, they have a second inventory and 4 more abilities that are meant for peeling a.k.a a support. Combine that with ridiculous damage and the class becomes op.

Well, we had double assassins, double bruisers, double mages, and all of those in-between with or without some mixing with supports. Oh my!

Also, ADCs at the dawn of League were originally played at mid, due to the shorter lane distance which back then were exploited as "shorter distance to safety and more farms for our sustain damage carry"; while bot lane was played as a supp plus a placeholder champ that changes based on the opponent's choice (people did get the clue of the importance of dragon and put 2 people at bot very quickly tho). So yes, bot was never only for ADCs; it took a few meta-shifts before Riot just suddenly decided that meta shouldn't evolve anymore and we now are stuck with the last meta we had. Kinda sad, really.

It isn't the statistically the strongest, or at least not always and will forever be the case; it's just Riot who actively keeps it that way through skewed balancing whenever meta-shifts were about to happen to ADC+Supp bot meta. Whenever something is changed and people are incentivised to try anything that was neither ADC or Supp at bot, they're immediately nerfed out of bot lane, and this has been repeated for at least what, 6 years already?
